summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from MCC New York, dated August 10, 2019, reporting a failure of the NICE camera system on August 8, 2019, which prevented the recovery of video footage from the housing unit. The document indicates a technician was notified and planned to fix the system the following day.

persons.name: Isis Lieutenan
persons.context: Author of the memorandum, reporting the camera system failure at MCC New York.

events.title: NICE Camera System Failure
events.description: At approximately 3:45 PM, while reviewing the NICE Camera System, the author discovered an inability to recover any previous video recordings from the unit 5-South Housing Unit. A check of all cameras confirmed none were recording.

events.title: Scheduled Camera System Repair
events.description: A communication technician, after being notified of the failure, stated he would fix the camera system when he arrived to work on Friday, August 9, 2019.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The NICE camera surveillance system at MCC New York's Unit 5-South Housing Unit was not recording on August 8, 2019.
No previous video footage could be recovered from the system at the time of the check.
A communication technician was notified and planned to repair the system on August 9, 2019.
The failure was documented in an official BOP memorandum dated August 10, 2019.
